info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 31 at 9:23AM MDT until September 1 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest New Mexico, including the following area, Southern Gila Region Highlands/Black Range.
* WHEN...Through this evening.
* IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Above average moisture will create efficient rainmakers this afternoon as thunderstorms develop across the high terrain. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the Southern Gila Highlands and Black Range. Flood-prone areas and burn scars are especially at risk. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING
